io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.common

Interface RequestMetricsCollector


  • @ProviderType
public interface RequestMetricsCollector
    Keeps track of all upstream resource that have been fetched while handling the current request, and collects additional data for performance analyze and caching. The collected information will be included in the responses created by Rhyme.renderResponse(LinkableResource).

    You shouldn't have to interact with this interface directly except for advanced integration or testing scenarios. Usually an instance of this interface is automatically created for each Rhyme instance, and can choose whether you want to include the embedded metadata in the response via RhymeBuilder.withMetadataConfiguration(RhymeMetadataConfiguration).

    If you are not working with RhymeBuilder, but are integrating HalApiClient and AsyncHalResponseRenderer separately, then you must make sure that you create just one instance of RequestMetricsCollector for each incoming request, and pass it over to both HalApiClientBuilder.withMetrics(RequestMetricsCollector) and HalResponseRendererBuilder.withMetrics(RequestMetricsCollector).

    See Also:
    RhymeMetadataConfiguration

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String EMBED_RHYME_METADATA
      The name of the query parameter that toggles whether the "rhyme:metadata" resource is embedded when rendering resources.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static RequestMetricsCollector create()
      Create a new instance to collect the full data on upstream requests and measure performance for the current incoming request.
      static RequestMetricsCollector createEssentialCollector()
      Create a minimal implementation that only captures the max-age value of upstream responses, but does not perform any other measurements and will not allow to render any embedded metadata into the response
      io.wcm.caravan.hal.resource.HalResource createMetadataResource(io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.resources.LinkableResource resourceImpl)
      Create a resource with performance analysis data that can be embedded in the response

      Calculates the "max-age" Cache-Control header value to be used when rendering the response.

    • Field Detail

      • EMBED_RHYME_METADATA

        static final String EMBED_RHYME_METADATA
        The name of the query parameter that toggles whether the "rhyme:metadata" resource is embedded when rendering resources. This applies only if you are using one of the framework integrations (e.g. Spring, AEM) in default configuration, where this logic is implemented with a framework specific RhymeMetadataConfiguration
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getResponseMaxAge

        Integer getResponseMaxAge()
        Calculates the "max-age" Cache-Control header value to be used when rendering the response.
        Returns:
        the minimum "max-age" value of all upstream requests and the limit set via setResponseMaxAge(Duration) (or null if none of this ever haooened)

      • setResponseMaxAge

        void setResponseMaxAge(Duration duration)
        Set the upper limit for the max-age header of the response to the current incoming request.
        Parameters:
        duration - the maximum cache duration

      • createMetadataResource

        io.wcm.caravan.hal.resource.HalResource createMetadataResource(io.wcm.caravan.rhyme.api.resources.LinkableResource resourceImpl)
        Create a resource with performance analysis data that can be embedded in the response
        Parameters:
        resourceImpl - the main resource being rendered in the current request
        Returns:
        a HalResource with detailed performance information for the current request

      • onResponseRetrieved

        void onResponseRetrieved(String resourceUri,
                         String resourceTitle,
                         Integer maxAgeSeconds,
                         long responseTimeMicros)
        Internal method called by the framework whenever an upstream resource has been retrieved
        Parameters:
        resourceUri - the URI of the resource that has been retrieved
        resourceTitle - the title of the resource that has been retrieved
        maxAgeSeconds - the value of the "max-age" header (or null if not available)
        responseTimeMicros - the time in microseconds between initiating the request and finishing parsing the response

      • onMethodInvocationFinished

        @Deprecated
void onMethodInvocationFinished(Class category,
                                            String methodDescription,
                                            long invocationDurationMicros)
        Deprecated. use startStopwatch(Class, Supplier) instead
        Internal method called by the framework to measure execution times of specific request processing stages
        Parameters:
        category - a class used to group measurements
        methodDescription - describes what task was executed
        invocationDurationMicros - the time in microseconds used to execute that task

      • startStopwatch

        RequestMetricsStopwatch startStopwatch(Class measuringClass,
                                       Supplier<String> taskDescription)
        Start measuring the execution time of a specific (possibly repeated) task within your own code. To finish the measurement, you have to call RequestMetricsStopwatch.close() when the task has been completed, or use a try-with-resources statement around the code section to be measured (since it's an AutoCloseable type). The result of your measurements will appear within the embedded "rhyme:metadata" resource in the rendered response.
        Parameters:
        measuringClass - only used to group the results in the "rhyme:metadata" resource into separate sections for each class
        taskDescription - provides a human readable description of the task (and context) that was executed. Measurements with the exact same task descriptions will be grouped, and the execution count and overall sum of execution times will be calculated
        Returns:
        a RequestMetricsStopwatch that you need to close to finish the measurement

      • create

        static RequestMetricsCollector create()
        Create a new instance to collect the full data on upstream requests and measure performance for the current incoming request. When this instance is used with AsyncHalResponseRenderer, a metadata resource with insight on performance and upstream requests will be automatically embedded in the response. If you don't need or want this, then use createEssentialCollector() instead
        Returns:
        a new full-featured instance of RequestMetricsCollector
        See Also:
        HalApiClientBuilder.withMetrics(RequestMetricsCollector), HalResponseRendererBuilder.withMetrics(RequestMetricsCollector)

      • createEssentialCollector

        static RequestMetricsCollector createEssentialCollector()
        Create a minimal implementation that only captures the max-age value of upstream responses, but does not perform any other measurements and will not allow to render any embedded metadata into the response
        Returns:
        a new instance of RequestMetricsCollector that implements only the essential functionality required for calculation of the max-age header to work
